com.viaoa.util.converter

Class OAConverterNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.util.converter.OAConverterNumber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OAConverterInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OAConverterBigDecimal

    public class OAConverterNumber
extends java.lang.Object
implements OAConverterInterface
    Convert to/from a Number value.
    Converting the following to a Number
    • null returns a number with value = 0
    • Any type of Number
    • String, using an optional format.
    • Color
    • Character
    • Boolean
    • Rectangle by encoding x,y,w,h in 16bit positions (64 bits required).
    • All others value will return null.

    Converting a Number to any of the following
    • String, using an optional format.

    Format String Symbol Meaning (same as DecimalFormat) 

        0      a digit, if no digit exists, then '0' will be used. 
                ex: '000' for 38 = '038'
    #      a digit, zero shows as absent
                ex: '#' for 8204 = '8204'
    .      placeholder for decimal separator
    ,      placeholder for grouping separator.
    ;      separates formats.
    -      default negative prefix.
    %      multiply by 100 and show as percentage
    (‰) ï¿½ multiply by 1000 and show as per mille
    (¤) ï¿½ currency sign; replaced by currency symbol; if
            doubled, replaced by international currency symbol.
            If present in a pattern, the monetary decimal separator
            is used instead of the decimal separator.
    X      any other characters can be used in the prefix or suffix
    '      used to quote special characters in a prefix or suffix.
    
    Examples:
    IntegerFormat     = #,###
    DecimalFormat     = #,##0.00
    MoneyFormat       = ¤#,##0.00
    BooleanFormat     = true;false;null
    
    ALSO** support for OAString.format

    NOTE: this also does rounding when digits are truncated.

    See Also:
    OAConverter, OAString.format(double, String)
